results.title: Music of the masters: 'Jesu, joy of man's desiring' Bach
results.brief_description: Prayerful lyricism of this Bach piece celebrated in H. Dexter’s sensitive arrangement for chamber trio (David Martin - violin; Barnard Richards - cello; Marie Goosens - harp). Delicate graceful gestures of the players are an apt counterpoint to the beauty of the music.

results.title: Music of the masters. No. 1. "On wings of song" - Mendelssohn
results.brief_description: A performance of Mendelssohn’s “On wings of song” by David Martin (violin), Barnard Richards (cello), Marie Goosens (harp). Arranged by H. Dexter. No dialogue.

results.title: Music of India: instrumental
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, M. Bhavnani and A. Bhaskar Rao
results.brief_description: A number of musical instruments are shown. Saraswati veena is a favourite stringed instrument of Southern India. Denai is a reed instrument, usually played in company with several other instruments. Sursazar is a complicated string instrument; the strings are plucked with the left hand and bowed with the right, at the same time. Sitar is a plucked string instrument, and one of the best known of Indian instruments. Tabla and baya are drums, played together, one with each hand; they are mostly used for accompaniment, but sometimes are played alone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Films Division, Government of India, M. Bhavnani and A. Bhaskar Rao

results.title: Music of India: drums
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, M. Bhavnani and A. Bhaskar Rao
results.brief_description: Shows the variety of drums used in the music and dances of India. Presents the intricate compositions played on the Pakhawaj, Mridang and Tabla by renowned artists.

results.title: Music lessons (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Describes how the Kodaly method of music instruction is being applied in American schools. The progression of learning; the training required to teach the method; the preparation for each lesson, and the commitment schools must make if they choose to adopt this method.
results.description: Describes how the Kodaly method of music instruction is being applied in American schools. The progression of learning; the training required to teach the method; the preparation for each lesson, and the commitment schools must make if they choose to adopt this method.

results.title: Music in the school
results.creator_credit: Royal Swedish Board of Education, Svensk Filmindustri and Margaretha Rosencrantz
results.brief_description: The teaching of music in Swedish schools. The place of music in the curriculum and as one of the outside interests provided for by the schools. The methods used in teaching singing, instrumental work, music appreciation, theory and history at all levels are shown in some detail. The soundtrack is in English except for children singing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Royal Swedish Board of Education, Svensk Filmindustri and Margaretha Rosencrantz

results.title: Music from Montreal
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: A film about the Montreal Bach Choir and its dynamic director, George Little. The choir is heard at rehearsal and in excerpts from a performance of Bach’s Christmas Oratorio.

results.title: Music for the movies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
Aaron Copland, famed American composer-pianist, narrates and conducts his own film musical scores. Copland has chosen music from “Red Pony”, “Our Town” and “Something Wild” as a framework in which to show the purpose and meaning of background scores for motion pictures. Featuring the New York Philharmonic.
